question:
Which among the following grants was/ were provided to Balaji Biswanath by the Mughal emperor Mohammad Shah?
1. Right to practice Chauth
2. Right to practice Sardesmukhi
3. The right of Swaraj
Choose the correct option from the codes given below :
explanation:
Balaji Biswanath was provided three grants by the Mughal emperor Mohammad Shah. First- Right to practice Chauth in southern India, Deccan, Mysore, Karnataka and Hyderabad. Chauth means 1/4th share of the total revenues.
Second- Right to practice Sardesmukhi (1/10th share)
Third- The right of Swaraj. That means the sovereignty of the Maratha empire over the country.
